channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-11469] KMS should skip default.key.acl and whitelist.key.acl when loading key acl
item.description: KMSACLs#setKeyACLs, loads key ACLs from the configuration by checking if the key name contains "key.acl". However, this also matches "default.key.acl" and "whitelist.key.acl" which is incorrect.
item.summary: KMS should skip default.key.acl and whitelist.key.acl when loading key acl

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Uploaded a simple patch to fix this issue.
Any comments? This is obviously an issue although it's not serious.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12690826/HADOOP-11469.001.patch
against trunk revision d336d13.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. There were no new javadoc warning messages.

+1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-kms.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/5398//testReport/

Hi dian.fu,

In general this looks good, but I think it would be good to add a unit test for this.

Charles

LGTM. +1 (non-binding)
Thanks clamb for review. Could you help to commit this patch if you think it's OK?
I wish I could, but I'm not a real committer. I only play one on TV. (That's why my +1 was non-binding). hitliuyi, would you be able to help out here?

Sure, sorry that I didn't pay attention to this JIRA.

The patch overall looks very good. One comment:

  • Our purpose is to match the configuration properties prefixed with key.acl., so the best way is to define a correct regex, not through a follow String#startsWith. My suggestion is we define a correct regex in KMSConfiguration as following: 
      public static final String KEY_ACL_PREFIX = "key.acl.";
+public static final String KEY_ACL_PREFIX_REGEX = "^key\\.acl\\..+";

    And use it KMSACLs:

    Map<String, String> allKeyACLS =
        conf.getValByRegex(KMSConfiguration.KEY_ACL_PREFIX_REGEX);

+1 after addressing.
Thanks hitliuyi] for review and comments. Have updated the patch according to your comments.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12694712/HADOOP-11469.004.patch
against trunk revision 6f9fe76.

This message is automatically generated.

Hi Dian, it's better we don't add the suffix check (KeyOpType) to regex:

+  StringUtils.join("|", Arrays.asList(KeyOpType.values())) + ")$"

Since we also have this check in the code:

        String keyOp = k.substring(keyNameEnds + 1);
        KeyOpType aclType = null;
        try {
          aclType = KeyOpType.valueOf(keyOp);
        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
          LOG.warn("Invalid key Operation '{}'", keyOp);
        }

And if some KeyOpType is typo in the configuration file, there is warning log. I think the KeyOpType is easy for typo, right? But the prefix (key.acl.) is simple.

Thanks hitliuyi for the comments. Agree with you that we should remove the suffix check, otherwise user will no longer receive the warning log if the a wrong operation is configured. Have updated the patch according to your comments. Thanks very much.

Thanks Dian for update. One small nit, +1 after that and pending Jenkins:

+import org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.kms.server.KeyAuthorizationKeyProvider.KeyOpType;
import org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path;
+import org.apache.hadoop.util.StringUtils;

import java.io.File;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;
+import java.util.Arrays;

These imports are unnecessary, and can cause Jenkins javac warning.
Updated the patch to remove unnecessary imports.
